Class WQWords

java.lang.Object
WQWords
public class WQWords
extends java.lang.Object
The WQWord class implements the random retrieval of the specified number of words to be fed to two players during a match. It also takes care of translating the randomly choosen words by sending GET requests to the MyMemory API.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dictionary
    The dictionary, contains wordNum words.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    WQWords​(int wordNum)
    Returns a new WQWords object and populates the dictionary ArrayList used to extract the match words.

    protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> requestWords()
    The requestWords method extracts random lines from the dictionary and asks for their translation via the getTranslation method.

    • WQWords

      public WQWords​(int wordNum)
      Returns a new WQWords object and populates the dictionary ArrayList used to extract the match words.

  • Method Details

    • requestWords

      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> requestWords() throws java.io.IOException
      The requestWords method extracts random lines from the dictionary and asks for their translation via the getTranslation method.
      Returns:
      an hashmap where the keys are the words and the values are the ArrayList containing the words translation.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something wrong happens during the getTranslation call.

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something strange happens.
